posts.title: Swift on Windows
posts.content: I think what The Browser Company is attempting to do with Swift on Windows is very intriguing. The beginning of Swift's open source life was very exciting and dynamic. More recently, it seems much of the interest has cooled. The idea of making cross-platform development more feasible with a powerful language option really sparks that excitement that I felt during the earlier days of Swift.
posts.author: Cameron Grigoriadis

posts.title: SwiftUI in Production
posts.content: Recent sentiment towards SwiftUI redesigns has continued to be mixed. I personally feel the benefits are huge and any wrinkles in experience will continue to be ironed out over time, as the framework becomes more second-nature to developers and Apple makes improvements. The ability to prototype and test applications with dramatically reduced overhead can lead to more refinement in the development process, and, in the end, a better product.
posts.author: Cameron Grigoriadis
